intro: Eberlanzia horrida, commonly known as the rough eberlanzia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Eberlanzia horrida is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
